page.title: 11SHREWTON STEAM LAUNDRY
page.content: The only small industry within this area is the Shrewton Steam Laundry. The original premises were used by a brewery, and although some of the original features were retained, the building was converted in 1917 for use as a Laundry. Today business contracts are negoti- ated with the military camps on Salis- bury Plain such as Larkhill, Bulford Camp, Tidworth Garrison, Boscombe Down and Warminster for the cleaning and pressing of dress uniforms, working overalls, plus linen and bedding used by the various messes in the area. Shrewton people make good use of the services offered by the Laundry, which has a very good reputation in the area. Mr. J Hall is the present owner and he employs 24 people including office and delivery staff.
